page.title: 17Sidmouth's Post Boxes.
page.content: There are 57 post boxes in the area covered by the Sidmouth Sorting Office. This area includes Sidmouth itself, Sidford, Sidbury, Bowd and Newton Poppleford. In this area there are{7 Victorian boxes, 4 Edwardian ones,{25 Georgian, 20 Elizabethan}and 1 which has not been traced. No hexagonal{Victorian}boxes remain, but there are 12 of the large cylindrical boxes of various reigns and the rest are wall mounted, post mounted or built into buildings. Between the wars as areas were modernised Victorian and Edwardian boxes were replaced. They did have a slight disadvantage as it was possible to remove or vandalise the card giving the time of collections. Now these old boxes are valued, are being preserved and modified so that the cards cannot be destroyed or removed.
